com.m3rcuriel.controve.util

Class DoubleMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.m3rcuriel.controve.util.DoubleMatrix

  • public class DoubleMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
    A relatively simple implementation of the Linear Algebra matrix using a 1D array, and only doubles.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DoubleMatrix(double[][] data)
      Construct a new DoubleMatrix from a 2D array.

      Construct a DoubleMatrix instance of the given size.
      DoubleMatrix(int height, int width, double[] data)
      Construct a new DoubleMatrix with the given single array data.

      • DoubleMatrix

        public DoubleMatrix(int width,
                    int height)
        Construct a DoubleMatrix instance of the given size.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the new matrix
        height - the height of the new matrix

      • DoubleMatrix

        public DoubleMatrix(double[][] data)
        Construct a new DoubleMatrix from a 2D array. For example: {{ 0, 1, 2, 1 }, { 1, 3, 4, 0 }, { 5, 1, 6, 5 }}

        would get

        0 1 2 1 1 3 4 0 5 1 6 5

        Parameters:
        data - the 2D array containing the matrix data

      • DoubleMatrix

        public DoubleMatrix(int height,
                    int width,
                    double[] data)
        Construct a new DoubleMatrix with the given single array data.
        Parameters:
        height - the height of the matrix
        width - the width of the matrix
        data - the data for the matrix

      • identity

        public static DoubleMatrix identity(int width,
                                    int height)
        Construct and identity matrix with a given height and width.

        For example, creating a 3x4 matrix would give: 1 0 0 0 1 0 0 0 1 0 0 0

        Parameters:
        width - the width of the matrix
        height - the height of the matrix
        Returns:
        the newly created identity matrix

      • multiply

        public static DoubleMatrix multiply(DoubleMatrix a,
                                    DoubleMatrix b)
        Multiply two matrices together.

        Note that the width of the first matrix must equal the height of the second

        Parameters:
        a - the first matrix
        b - the second matrix
        Returns:
        the resultant matrix
